API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.util.BezierUtil

type
class
version
3.1
since
1.0
Utility class for Bézier calculations.

All credits go to Alex Ulhmann and his Animation Package Library.

Static Variables

casteljau(default,method) : p : Float -> plist : Array<sandy.core.data.Point3D> -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

Applies the de Casteljau's algorithm.

<strong>ToDo</strong>: Better explanations - link to wikipedia

casteljau_interval(default,method) : p : Float -> plist : Array<sandy.core.data.Point3D> -> pdeb : Int -> pfin : Int -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

Applies a more robust de Casteljau's algorithm if the intervals are "wierd".

UNTESTED METHOD. MAY BE REMOVED IN THE FUTURE VERSION. USE IT CAREFULLY.

<strong>ToDo</strong>: Better explanations - link to wikipedia

getCubicControlPoints(default,method) : start : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> through1 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> through2 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> end : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> Array<sandy.core.data.Point3D>

Returns the control points for a qubic Bézier curve.

If anybody finds a generic method to compute control points for bezier curves with n control points, if only the points on the curve are given, please let us know!

getPointsOnCubicCurve(default,method) : p : Float -> p1 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> p2 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> p3 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> p4 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

Returns a point on a qubic Bézier curve.

Adapted from Paul Bourke.

getPointsOnQuadCurve(default,method) : p : Float -> p1 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> p2 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> p3 : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

Returns a point on a quadratic Bézier curve.

Adapted from Robert Penner
with Robert Penner's optimization of the standard equation.

getQuadControlPoints(default,method) : start : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> middle : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> end : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

Returns the control point for a quadratic Bézier curve.

Adapted from Robert Penner's drawCurve3Pts() method
